subject: Parenting
title: Synaptic Pruning
description: A fast breakdown of Synaptic Pruning for builders.

hook.text: A two-year-old has twice as many brain connections as an adult. That's not an advantage.

buildup.text: The brain overproduces synapses, then eliminates the ones that aren't used.

discovery.text: It's called synaptic pruning â€” use it or lose it, on a neural level.

twist.text: The connections that survive are the ones strengthened by repeated experience.

climax.text: Childhood habits and environments shape the brain's permanent architecture.

punchline.text: The brain grows by subtracting, not just adding.
